boardgame.description:
The Mind is more than just a game. It's an experiment, a journey, a team experience in which you can't exchange information, yet will become one to defeat all the levels of the game.

In more detail, the deck contains cards numbered 1-100, and during the game you try to complete 12, 10, or 8 levels of play with 2, 3, or 4 players. In a level, each player receives a hand of cards equal to the number of the level: one card in level 1, two cards in level 2, etc. Collectively you must play these cards into the center of the table on a single discard pile in ascending order but you cannot communicate with one another in any way as to which cards you hold. You simply stare into one another's eyes, and when you feel the time is right, you play your lowest card. If no one holds a card lower than what you played, great, the game continues! If someone did, all players discard face up all cards lower than what you played, and you lose one life.

You start the game with a number of lives equal to the number of players. Lose all your lives, and you lose the game. You start with one shuriken as well, and if everyone wants to use a shuriken, each player discards their lowest card face up, giving everyone information and getting you closer to completing the level. As you complete levels, you might receive a reward of a shuriken or an extra life. Complete all the levels, and you win!

For an extra challenge, play The Mind in extreme mode with all played cards going onto the stack face down. You don't look at the cards played until the end of a level, losing lives at that time for cards played out of order.

The game includes four double-sided wipeable playing boards for variety.

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls Online - Dragon Bones
boardgame.description:
The Elder Scrolls Online: Thieves Guild is an official DLC game pack for The Elder Scrolls Online. This DLC game pack includes two brand-new dungeons, each with their own unique challenges and rewards: Scalecaller Peak and Fang Lair.

In Scalecaller Peak, the burial site of a long-dead Dragon Priest is now overrun with diseased cultists harboring an evil agenda: to unleash the deadliest plague Tamriel has ever known. You and your team must journey to Scalecaller Peak, battle your way through the cultists and their followers, and put an end to this threat.

Deep within the belly of Fang Lair, an ancient Dwarven ruin, a master of necromancy works a dark ritual in an effort to reanimate the bones of a once-living dragon. It's up to you and your companions to enter the dungeon, face the necromancers, and stop the ritual before this undead monstrosity can be unleashed on Tamriel.

These new dungeons pit you and your team against new and returning enemies, including plague-ridden ogres, powerful sorcerers and their undead creations, and the reanimated bones of an ancient dragon.

Both Scalecaller Peak and Fang Lair will be available in normal and veteran modes, and they will include a veteran Hard Mode for the final boss.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: 朧ニンジャスタートリック (Oboro Ninja Star Trick)
boardgame.description:
User summary
朧ニンジャスタートリック (Oboro Ninja Star Trick) is a three-player trick-taking game where the players must follow suit (play the same color as the card that was lead) if possible, and the player who played the card with the highest value wins the trick regardless of the color. In case of a tie, the player who took their turn later among them wins the trick.

Sort the cards you have taken into three color piles with the lowest value card taken from the current trick on top of each pile. Among the players with the total value of cards on top of their piles ("Ninja Power") not exceeding the specified Mission Value, the players with more Ninja Power receive more points.

Meanwhile, the players with more Shuriken pieces, which can be gained by the card "6", receive more additional points.

Publisher's summary
三人専用のトリックテイキングゲームです。
マストフォローでカードをプレイしますが、トリックの勝敗は数字の大きさだけで競います。同じ数字の場合は後手番が勝利します。
獲得したトリックは、色別に山札を作って獲得しますが、獲得するときに一番小さい数字を山札の上に置きます。その合計数字が決められた数を越えている場合、得点は得られません。決められた数字内でより大きな合計値のプレイヤーが高得点を獲得します。また、６のカードで獲得できる手裏剣コマの数を比べて、数が多いプレイヤーが高得点を獲得します。
